  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommandTemplate, RanCommand

    • Method Detail

      • getSender

        Sender getSender()
        Returns:
        whoever issued the command, which may not be the Player/Persona target

      • msg

        void msg(java.lang.String message,
         java.lang.Object... format)
        Send a formatted message to the command issuer
        Parameters:
        message - The message in String.format / printf compliant style
        format - the formatting parameters

      • msg

        void msg(java.lang.Object message)

      • msg

        void msg(net.md_5.bungee.api.chat.BaseComponent message)
        Send a Json-formatted message to the command issuer (Json features only work on players)
        Parameters:
        message - The message in a bungee BaseComponent format

      • msgRaw

        void msgRaw(java.lang.String message)
        Send something to the command issuer
        Parameters:
        message - an unformatted string message

      • error

        void error(java.lang.String err)
        Terminate the command sequence execution immediately in a way that the command engine understands
        Parameters:
        err - an error message that will be formatted and provided to the command sender

      • validate

        void validate(boolean condition,
              java.lang.String error)
        Shorthand method to simplify the command flow. Require something is true or terminate with an error message otherwise.
        Parameters:
        condition - something that you require to be true at this point in the command sugar
        error - the error message the commandSender will see if the condition fails

      • hasFlag

        boolean hasFlag(java.lang.String flagName)
        Parameters:
        flagName - The Flag Name to check
        Returns:
        if the Flag exists or not

      • getFlag

        <T> T getFlag(java.lang.String flagName)
        Parameters:
        flagName - the Flag Name to check
        Returns:
        The argument sender provided with the flag, or some default
